titlestmt.titleproper: League of Women Voters of Texas (Lubbock Chapter):
titlestmt.subtitle: An Inventory of Its Records, 1945-1978 and undated, at the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library
titlestmt.author: Abel Ramirez

titlepage.titleproper: Inventory for the League of Women Voters of Texas (Lubbock Chapter) Records, 1945-1978 and undated
titlepage.author: Abel Ramirez

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: League of Women Voters (Lubbock, Tex.) Records, Records, 1945-1978 and undated
did.abstract: Records of the Lubbock, Texas, chapter of the League of Women Voters of Texas from 1945-1978 and undated.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: The League of Women Voters of Texas is a non-partisan organization that works to promote political responsibility through active informed participation of all citizens in their government. The national organization was founded in 1920 and shortly thereafter began organizing state groups.

The Lubbock League of Women Voters of Texas is affiliated with the National League of Women Voters, and changed from provisional to official membership status in 1952. Its purpose is to promote political responsibility through informal and active participation of citizens in government. Specific programs for the Lubbock community include voter registration, low-income housing, housing for the elderly and disabled, women's rights, and library development.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection is arranged in three major divisions entitled Lubbock materials, materials collected, and materials collected-cities and towns. Within these divisions the records are grouped by subjects. Printed materials include newsletters, guides, news clippings, and brochures. Some unique materials, such as reports and correspondence, are interfiled within subject categories.
Along with histories of various groups, the collection also contains documentation on issues such as traffic safety, home rule, water, poll taxes, and the Lubbock Community Planning Council.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: The subject headings used by the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library are derived from the Library of Congress and/or locally developed.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: League of Women Voters of Texas (Lubbock Chapter) Records, 1945-1978 and undated, Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University, Lubbock, Texas

relatedmaterial.p: For related materials located in the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, see the following collections:
